content.description:
I doubt this is a first ascent, and so if someone knows of this route by another name feel free to change it. First (known) ascent: Adam Boulianne, Alexandre Sauvé, 05/2020. We climbed it ground up, brushed and cleaned as much as we could and left no bolts. All belays are on natural protection.

Pitch 1 (5.7, 20m) Climb up the gully to a big tree coming out of a roof. Loose rock, watch your belayer !

Pitch 2 (5.8, 25m) From the tree go straight up into the hard to protect stem box, make a committing slab move to the seam under the roof and traverse hard right. Go up the gully and build your belay close to the roof.

Pitch 3 (5.10+, 35m) A short, powerful crux off the anchor leads to a beautiful dihedral. Belay at the top of the corner. Classic.

Pitch 4 (5.9, 35m) Traverse hard left and follow the corners to a steep crack. Make a dynamic move to the top. Belay on the tree near the summit. Fun !

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zzICMIu5zFY

The route starts in the obvious gully in the center of the face.
Standard rack to #3, alpine draws, metal brush.

Follow the main crack line.  Trad anchors.

Left side of cliff.  The first striking line above the leftmost talus field.
small to medium cams and nuts.
North West facing cliff.  The quality climbs are probably ranging up to 30 meters in height.  Definitely a quiet cliff with little to no development done on its faces yet.
